intro.title: About the Institute
intro.subtitle: Heritage · Innovation · Collaboration · Inclusion · Professionalism
intro.p1: The Greater Bay Area Culture Digital Research Institute was established under the GBA cultural development strategy to implement the Outline Development Plan for the GBA and the National Cultural Digitalization Strategy. The Institute integrates the four cultural systems of Lingnan culture, HK-Macao culture, red and contemporary culture, and ethnic and folk culture, dedicated to excavating, reconstructing, and disseminating GBA's rich cultural heritage through cutting-edge digital technology.
intro.p2: With 'Culture as Soul, Digital as Wings' as its core philosophy, the Institute not only carries the academic mission of preserving GBA's cultural heritage in the digital era, but also leverages the multi-stakeholder collaborative advantage of government-industry-school-enterprise cooperation, leading the transformation of cultural resources into digital assets and helping build the GBA cultural community.

meta.title: Culture Systems | GBA Culture Digital Institute
meta.description: Explore the four cultural systems of the Greater Bay Area: Lingnan culture, HK-Macao culture, red and contemporary culture, and ethnic and folk culture.

hero.title: Four Cultural Systems
hero.subtitle: Rooted in Lingnan, diverse cultures thrive — building the GBA cultural community together

systems.title: Lingnan Culture
systems.subtitle: The Common Foundation of GBA
systems.desc: Lingnan culture is GBA's deepest cultural root, with Cantonese, Hakka, and Teochew cultures coexisting and thriving. Cantonese opera, lion dance, dragon boats, herbal tea, arcade buildings — every cultural symbol carries the shared memory and spiritual identity of GBA's people.

subsystems.title: Cantonese Culture
items: Cantonese Opera · Pearl of the South

systems.digitalTag: Digital Focus: 3D Arcade Building Models · Cantonese Opera Digital Preservation · Intangible Heritage Digital Database

systems.title: Hong Kong & Macao Culture
systems.subtitle: The Unique Character of East Meets West
systems.desc: Due to their unique historical backgrounds, Hong Kong and Macao have nurtured a distinctive identity of deep East-West cultural fusion. From Hong Kong pop culture's profound influence across Asia to Macao's eclectic Macanese heritage, HK-Macao culture is the best embodiment of GBA's cultural diversity.

subsystems.title: Macao Culture
items: Ruins of St. Paul's · Historic Landmark

systems.digitalTag: Digital Focus: Ruins of St. Paul's 3D Model · HK-Macao Digital Exhibition Hall · Pop Culture Digital Archive

systems.title: Red & Contemporary Culture
systems.subtitle: The Spiritual Foundation for Innovation
systems.desc: GBA is a cradle of modern Chinese history — the Boca Tigris, birthplace of the 1911 Revolution. The red gene forges GBA's spiritual foundation. Shenzhen's technological innovation leads the cultural creative renaissance, making 'digital culture' and 'tech innovation' the new symbols of the era.
systems.digitalTag: Digital Focus: Red Culture Digital Exhibition · VR Historical Scene Restoration · Red Audio Books

systems.title: Ethnic & Folk Culture
systems.subtitle: A Vibrant Canvas of Diversity
systems.desc: GBA is home to multiple ethnic minorities including Zhuang, Yao, She, and Li peoples, whose rich cultures form the colorful foundation of GBA. Spring Festival flower markets, Dragon Boat racing, Qixi Festival — shared folk traditions unite the cultural identity of GBA's people.

items: Spring Festival Flower Market · New Year Spirit
